SENIOR FINANCE MANAGER

SUMMARY

Highly driven finance professional with over 8 years of progressive experience in the advertising and entertainment industry.
Extremely proficient with managing month-end, quarter — end , and year-end deadlines.
Highlights
Staff management/development Balance sheet reconciliations Process improvement Managing audit requests Financial reporting Cash flow analysis Budget development Excellent research and financial analysis abilities Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word, and Microsoft PowerPoint. Experience with SAP R3/BW, Maconomy, Business Objects, JD Edwards

EXPERIENCE

Senior Finance Manager
January 2015
to
January 2016
Company Name
Supervise the media finance, production, client finance, accounts payable and accounts receivable departments.
Manage the monthly accounting close and consolidation of monthly reports.
Manage the monthly accounting close efficiently and accurately.
Prepare monthly financial statements (Balance Sheet, P&L, Cash Flow) & variance analysis for the company.
Analyze intercompany transactions and oversee monthly reconciliations.
Provide weekly cash flow projections to CFO and manage cash balances with Dir. of Treasury.
Manage internal and external audits, ensure good and effective internal controls are in place.
Assist in establishing accounting and operational policies/procedures as well as consistent reporting for each department.
Assist in leading the implementation of Maconomy system across the office which includes training and streamlining policies.
Review and post all entities' journal entries ensuring completeness and accuracy.
Ensure that all monthly balance sheet reconciliations are completed and any reconciling items are addressed and resolved.
Coordinate and serve as primary contact with Company's external auditors, ensuring that accounting transactions are complete and accurate prior to external audits.
Manage internal and external audits, ensure good and effective internal controls are in place.
Provide timely reporting to department heads and upper management.

Primary point of contact for all A/P inquiries.
Conduct timesheet audits and follow up with staff on the submitting and approving of weekly timesheets.
Provide ad hoc reports and analysis to account and finance teams.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Senior Accountant

Location: Fairfax, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Job DescriptionAs a Senior Accountant, you are responsible for examining, analyzing, and interpreting accounting records to prepare financial statements, give advice, and audit and evaluate statements prepared by others. You will also install or advise on systems of recording costs or other financial and budgetary data.
Job Duties & ResponsibilitiesExamine, analyze, and interpret accounting records, documents, and reports to ensure accuracy and compliance with established accounting standards and principles.Perform month close activities under USGAAP and IFRS.Perform timely balance sheet reconciliationsResponsible for maintaining and documenting of internal controls to comply with Sarbanes-Oxley in the assigned areas.Prepare accurate and timely financial reports, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements.Collaborate with colleagues to develop and maintain effective financial and budgetary data recording systems.Provide advice and recommendations to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of accounting processes and procedures.Conduct internal and external audits to ensure that financial records are accurate and in compliance with applicable laws and regulations.Assist in the development and implementation of financial policies and procedures to promote accurate and timely financial reporting.Complete additional tasks or responsibilities as assigned.
Work ExperienceRequires in depth knowledge and experienceUses best practice and knowledge of internal or external business issues to improve products or servicesSolves complex problems.Has strong analytic abilities.Excellent attention to details.Takes a new perspective using existing solutionsWorks independently, receives minimal guidanceHas 5 to 7 years of work experienceAdvanced Microsoft office skills required.Experience with major ERP systems - SAP preferred.
EducationAssociate's Degree, Bachelor's Degree or Master's Degree in a related field is preferred.Equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.
CertificationsCertifications may be required or preferred.
If you feel that you meet the above criteria, we look forward to receiving your application!
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, genetics, gender identity or expression, national origin, or disability.

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
